title: Abdulaziz of Saudi Arabia
summary: Abdulaziz bin Abdul Rahman Al Saud (Arabic: عبد العزيز بن عبد الرحمن آل سعود ʿAbd al ʿAzīz bin ʿAbd ar Raḥman Āl Suʿūd; 15 January 1875[note 2] – 9 November 1953), known in the West as Ibn Saud (Arabic: ابن سعود Ibn Suʿūd),[note 3] was an Arab tribal, political, and religious leader and statesman[1] who founded Saudi Arabia, the third Saudi state. He reigned as the first king of Saudi Arabia from 23 September 1932 to his death in 1953. He had ruled parts of the kingdom since 1902, having previously been Emir, Sultan, and King of Nejd, and King of Hejaz.
